problem.p: An object of mass m is hanging by a string from the roof of an elevator. We want to compare the tension in the string due to the weight of the object under various conditions. Which statements are true?

li.p: If the elevator is moving up at constant speed, the tension in the string is equal to the object's weight
If the elevator is moving downwards, and speeding up, the tension in the string is larger than the object's weight
If the elevator is moving downwards, and slowing down, the tension in the string is greater than the object's weight
If the elevator is moving upwards, and speeding up, the tension in the string is smaller than the object's weight
If the elevator is moving downwards in free fall, the tension in the string is equal to zero
